TopicTitle: Loading a project inside another project?

Articles.Content:
Lets say I am building a rocket for one purpose and then I want to load inside this project another ship I builted previously, lets say a lunar lander for example.

Is there a way to do this? stock or mod?

Thanks

Subassemblies/merge option on the load craft menu?

See this thread on how to set things up so that when you "project-ception' your craft, they can be attached to each other.

You want to attach the two ships together? What you do is use the re-root gizmo to set the attachment point as the root part of one ship. Save that ship. Load the other ship. Open the load screen, select the first ship, and click the "Merge" button. Now you can attach the two ships together.

Even better, you don't need to reroot before saving - all you need to do is to build rockets/modules/whatever normally, then after clicking "merge", you can reroot the incoming inactive ship before attaching it to the main ship.

I've never touched subassembly feature once I discovered rerooting inactive ship is possible.

6 hours ago, FancyMouse said:

Even better, you don't need to reroot before saving - all you need to do is to build rockets/modules/whatever normally, then after clicking "merge", you can reroot the incoming inactive ship before attaching it to the main ship.

I've never touched subassembly feature once I discovered rerooting inactive ship is possible.

Learnt a new thing today! Will try it out soon.
Thanks for all the help, both solutions worked for me!
